Weapons/Armor/Equipment: My fists, A Dual pistol M-10AF, I wear Reinforced boots, pants and hoodie to protect from small impacts (such as fall, light cuts or fist fights)
Backstory: Exo Synth grew up in a cramped apartment above a busted-up repair shop, raised by the only family he ever knew—his grandfather, the last to play alternative rock before the corps scrubbed it from the airwaves. The old man wasn’t just a musician; he was a relic of a time when music had teeth. He taught Exo that sound was a weapon, that lyrics could shatter chains. But belief isn’t armor. One day, Exo found him slumped over his guitar, an “accidental” overdose on corpo-brand meds he never trusted. Exo never found out if it was the corps that silenced him or if, after years of fighting, the old man just... let go. And that thought keeps him up at night. Now, Exo is the loudest voice in the underground, spitting raw anthems against the machine, hijacking airwaves, making corpos sweat. But it’s not just about rebellion—he needs to prove to himself that his grandfather wasn’t wasting his breath.

That the fight still means something. Yet, in the quiet, doubt lingers. His voice, the tool of his defiance, is enhanced by hacked black-market vocal mods—dangerous, unstable, but necessary. The irony isn’t lost on him. Some nights, staring at his reflection, he wonders if he’s becoming the thing he hates. If, piece by piece, he's selling himself off just to be heard. The corps have tried to buy him out, dangled contracts promising reach, influence, power. Once, in a moment of exhaustion, he almost said yes. Almost let himself believe he could beat them from the inside. But then he heard his grandfather’s voice in his head: Don’t let them own you. So Exo keeps playing. Keeps burning bright. Not because he’s sure he’ll win, but because if he stops, the silence might kill him.

**MedusaCascade**: Name: Jack 'Hangman' Chlotna
Age: 23
Occupation: Enforcer Within the Skeleton Crew. Psychological Profile: Focused, Trained. Physical Description: 6'3 Tall Male, Mostly Organic Exotic Body, Protogen head for replacement. Chrome/Implants: Lynx Paws, Titanium Bones, Rara Avis
Skills/Abilities: Ability to See in the Dark [NVG/Thermal]
Weapons/Armor/Equipment: P401, Thompson, Mastiff
Backstory: Jack Chlotna was born into the cold, polished world of corporate privilege, the son of a high-ranking executive at the powerful Arasaka Corporation. On the surface, his family had everything—luxury, influence, and respect. But behind closed doors, Jack's life was far from perfect. His father, Markus Chlotna, was a man driven by ambition, power, and an overwhelming need to control everyone around him. Jack quickly learned that his father's love was conditional, and it came with a price. From an early age, Jack was pushed to be perfect—grades, behavior, performance—all meticulously controlled. Any failure, no matter how small, was met with cold, calculated punishment. Markus was cruel, both physically and emotionally, using Jack’s every mistake as an excuse to tear him down. His mother, often too afraid to intervene, was little more than a passive figure in their home, leaving Jack to fend for himself in a world where his value was determined by his father’s ever-changing standards. As Jack grew older, the weight of his father's expectations became unbearable. He began to resent the corporate world that had stripped him of his own identity, replacing it with a never-ending cycle of achievement and compliance. At 18, after years of enduring abuse and manipulation, Jack made the decision to escape. He left the Chlotna estate in the dead of night, cutting all ties with his family and the life his father had planned for him. Jack Chlotna is now an enforcer for the Backstreet Butcher Boys, a gang that thrives on brutality and fear in Night City’s darkest corners.

Born and raised in the chaotic sprawl of Watson, Jack’s life was always on the edge. he quickly rose through the ranks of the Butcher Boys with his ruthless efficiency and unflinching loyalty. His skills with weapons and hand-to-hand combat made him a feared figure in the underworld, but it wasn’t until a tragic accident that Jack truly became a legend. During a routine hit gone wrong, Jack was caught in an explosion that left him disfigured beyond recognition. His face was gone, destroyed in the blast, and the doctors couldn’t repair the damage. Instead of fading into obscurity, Jack made the decision to replace his lost face with a cutting-edge Protogen visor—a sleek, high-tech piece of cyberware that not only shields his identity but enhances his vision with thermal, night, and augmented reality capabilities. The visor became a symbol of his transformation into something more than human, a reminder that in Night City, you can lose everything and still come back stronger. Additional Notes:

**MedusaCascade**: Character Name: Jixx

Alias: “Whisper”
Age: 21
Pronouns: He/They
Occupation: Freelance Operative | Dealer | Assassin
Affiliation: Independent (formerly gang-affiliated)
Core Cyberware (CWP: 9)
Implant    Description
Full Exotic Conversion (Fox)    Permanent physical exotic surgery—digitigrade legs, muzzle, tail, etc. Echo Skin (Holographic Masking)   , Silent step, voice weaver, chameleon skin, ghost tag

Total CWP: 9/10

    Above 6 would require increased RP of instability or trigger cyberpsychosis rolls. Psychological Profile

Withdrawn, cautious, and highly observant. Jixx suffers from moderate identity dysphoria and trauma due to the forced exotic conversion. Feels more like himself in his current form, but carries a fractured sense of self due to the masking tech and years of isolation. Trusts few, but clings fiercely to people who show him genuine kindness. Prone to emotional outbursts under stress. Struggles with guilt, rage, and a deep desire to feel “real.”
Physical Description

Standing at 5’8” with a sleek, lean frame, Jixx is a fully converted fox-like exotic—digitigrade legs, elongated ears, fur-like synthetic skin, a functional tail, and a subtly glowing bioluminescent muzzle. These features are not cosmetic—they’re surgically bonded augments from years of full-body cybernetic alteration. However, when the Echo Skin holographic field is active, Jixx appears to be a slim, pale human teenager with light brown hair and tired eyes. The illusion is imperfect under scrutiny or during glitching (stress, damage, or hacking attempts). Backstory

Jixx was taken from his family at a young age by INTRA Industries, a black-site biotech corp specializing in exotic body modification and psychological warfare implants. Dubbed a "Shifter Project," Jixx was one of several children raised in sterile, isolated cells where their identities were slowly dismantled and replaced. INTRA’s goal?

Develop operatives who could infiltrate, distract, seduce, or eliminate using programmable identities. Jixx was forcibly transformed over years of surgical augmentation—his exotic body not chosen, but forced upon him for testing the limits of identity-based psychological control. The implant codenamed “Echo” was installed late in his development. It allowed Jixx to project a synthetic human appearance—not as a transformation, but as a disguise. He was trained to blend, to obey, and to be a weapon. At 16, an unexpected gang raid on the INTRA facility shattered the experiment. The lab’s wing was destroyed, the children set free into a world they barely understood. Jixx was taken in by the gang who orchestrated the raid—not out of kindness, but as a curiosity and later a useful asset. He was nicknamed “Whisper” due to his ability to get in and out undetected, leveraging his Echo disguise to bypass checkpoints. Over time, he became a drug runner and intelligence asset, climbing ranks quickly—but the stress of conflicting identities and unregulated cyberware began to crack him. After showing signs of instability and a near-cyberpsychotic episode, the gang exiled him. In a blind rage, Jixx returned and attacked their safehouse, leaving several wounded before fleeing. Now, Jixx survives alone in the slums of Night City, selling immunoblockers, black market data, and designer narcotics, while accepting high-risk jobs for assassination, infiltration, and sabotage. His true goal? Find any surviving members of the Shifter Project and unravel the truth of what INTRA did to him. And maybe—just maybe—figure out which version of himself is really real. Roleplay Hooks
Still has INTRA corporate secrets hardcoded into memory

    Constantly monitors for other “Shifter” escapees

    Can switch between Exotic and human form visually (but not physically)

    Doesn’t know if his body is his or something built

    Collects trinkets and music obsessively as comfort anchors

Once she was in, she was given *experimental implants* - mainly the cybernetic lungs that she was given to produce a drug  which could be blown out from her mouth.

This drug named *"Vulcan"* is used to release positive chemicals and can help ease stress and anxiety, used to calm ones mind and body. Vulcan was used  when interrogating individuals for large batches of information, which was proven effective after the first few runs of its use. Although due to the lungs having issues within her small body, they had received an exotics full-body conversion. After a few years of working within Arasaka, Vivian had been promoted to a higher rank, and at the same time an information leak had occurred that was disguised to look like Viv had done it. Although her family had known that she hadn't done it, Arasaka deemed her a traitor and attempted to send a squad to end her life. Lucky enough for her she ran into the Mafia in town including their boss *"Butcher"*, they assisted her in fending off the small, unequipped kill squad. Living in hiding for quite awhile under the protection of *Butcher* and his crew. Viv's family proved her innocence as a co-worker congregated the leak to get her killed for stealing their promotion. Attempting to get her back to Arasaka, Viv decided to stay within the city with the Mafia as she seen how easy the Corpo turned on her on one thing. From her view, everything had been cleared for her and Araska was no longer after her. **MedusaCascade**: NCRP CHARACTER SHEET
Name: Sir Lazarus (Formerly Elias Kessler)
Age: 34 (Biologically) | Unknown (Post-Cyberization)
Pronouns: He/Him
Occupation: Arasaka Security Asset / Corporate Enforcer

Psychological Profile:
Sir Lazarus is a man trapped in the shell of a machine—a cybernetic knight bound by archaic ideals and corporate programming. He speaks like a chivalric warrior, addressing others as “ser,” “milady,” or “knave.” His flowery, medieval way of speaking can be both amusing and unsettling, especially in the brutal reality of Night City. Arasaka’s mental conditioning forces him to see his work as righteous service to his lord. Deep down, fragments of Elias Kessler still linger—painful memories of a past life, old friendships, and a betrayal he can’t quite recall. His loyalty programming forces him forward, but the cracks are growing. One day, he will wake up. One day, he will break free. Physical Description:
Sir Lazarus is a towering cybernetic warrior, built with reinforced musculature that enhances his strength but not to superhuman extremes. His pale chrome plating is weathered from battle, and his red-tinted visor flickers unpredictably, hinting at instability in his neural interface. He moves like a man still adjusting to his own strength—sometimes too stiff, sometimes too fluid, as if parts of him remember being human while others have long forgotten. Despite his power, he is not unstoppable. His joints and articulation points are vulnerable, and his heavy frame makes him less agile than a fully human opponent. Cyberware:
Smart Eyes2EyeZoom, thermal, night vision, facial ID, AR HUD.Eyes glow. You sometimes blink asynchronously. Dermal Plating3SkinResistant to blades, blunt trauma, small arms.Feels cold to the touch. Looks synthetic. Scanners flag you. Subdermal Grip1HandsLet’s you hold objects tighter than human limits—great for weapons or grappling.Sometimes crushes fragile stuff by accident.

**MedusaCascade**: Skills/Abilities:
    •    Master of Heavy Weaponry: Specializes in oversized melee weapons, lances, and high-calibre firearms. His fighting style prioritizes overwhelming force over speed. •    Chivalric Combat Doctrine: His knightly-inspired martial arts emphasize precise, disciplined strikes, whether with blades, gauntlets, or firearms. His style is formal, methodical, and calculated. •    Tactical Awareness: Despite his outdated ideals, he is a brilliant battlefield strategist, reading opponents’ movements with military precision. •    Programming Instability: Occasional moments of clarity allow glimpses of Elias Kessler’s past life, which can either strengthen or weaken his resolve. If his memories surface too strongly, he hesitates in combat, giving enemies openings. Weapons/Armor/Equipment:
    •    Arasaka Railgun:
A shoulder-mounted, high-calibre magnetic acceleration weapon designed for long-range engagements. •    Weaknesses:
    •    Bulky & Heavy: Cannot be fired while moving; he must brace himself before each shot. •    Cooldown Required: One powerful shot before a cooldown period (30–60 seconds depending on charge level). •    Severe Recoil: Requires his reinforced musculature to withstand the force. A misfire or faulty calibration can stagger him. •    Fire Modes:
    •    Low-Power: Fast-firing suppression rounds (weaker than a standard rifle). •    Mid-Power: Armor-piercing rounds, effective against light mechs and cyberware. •    High-Power: Anti-material blast requiring a long charge time and exposing his position. •    VioTech MechaBappers (Cybernetic Gauntlets):
A pair of massive, mechanical fists, powered by kinetic energy. These replace a standard prosthetic hand and serve as both offense and utility. •    Modes:
    •    Brawler Mode: Crushing melee blows that can stagger most enemies. Not superhuman—just mechanically enhanced
    •    Weakness: Fire, water, and electricity can disable the gauntlets until reset.

•    IRON PLATE AT-0122 Retractable Combat Shield:
A dense, military-grade combat shield deployed from his left forearm. •    Strengths: Blocks melee strikes and gunfire, allowing him to advance under fire. •    Weaknesses: Cannot block explosives or high calibre rounds and is too heavy for prolonged use in combat. •    Neural Override Collar (Failsafe):
If he deviates too far from his programming, Arasaka can remotely disable him. Weaknesses & Balancing Factors:
    •    Slow & Heavy: His full body cyberware makes him slower than human opponents. His railgun and shield weigh him down further. •    Limited Railgun Usage: His primary weapon has a cooldown, high recoil, and must be braced before firing. This makes him vulnerable in fast-paced combat. •    Vulnerable Joints: His Armor is reinforced but has weak points at articulation joints, which skilled opponents can exploit. •    Memory Glitches: His suppressed memories create internal conflicts, sometimes causing hesitation in battle. •    Neural Kill Switch: If he becomes too unstable, Arasaka can shut him down remotely.

**MedusaCascade**: Backstory:

Elias Kessler was a combat engineer for Arasaka, specializing in cyberware modification and battlefield repairs. Unlike mercenaries or edgerunners, he was never meant to fight—until Arasaka made him into a weapon. After an incident involving classified tech, Arasaka forced him into full cybernetic augmentation, stripping away most of his organic body and memories. His programming suppresses his past, leaving only a warrior devoted to the corporation. But cracks in his mind let fragments of Elias Kessler resurface. He sometimes remembers a garage filled with tools. He sometimes remembers a woman’s voice. He sometimes remembers what it felt like to be human. And when those moments come, the ghost in the machine fights back. Personality & Speech Pattern:
    •    Talks like a knight: Uses old-fashioned speech, addressing others formally. •    “Halt, knave! Face me with honour!”
    •    “Serrah, thou dost not comprehend the perils before thee.”
    •    “Forsooth, ’tis but a scratch!”
    •    Contradictory Mentality: Believes in honour and duty yet serves a corrupt corporation. •    Occasionally defies orders without understanding why.
**MedusaCascade**:

**MedusaCascade**: Name: Keith M. Murphy | “ECH-0 3”


Age: Ninety-Three (Chronologically) | Early Fifties (Physically)(08/24/1985)

Pronouns: He/Him

Occupation: Bartender by trade, Soldier-for-Hire by necessity. Psychological Profile: 

    Keith M. Murphy is seemingly a calm, humble, and some would dare say, meek old man. He treats those who enter the bar with respect and kindness, and almost never speaks up for himself unless he has to, opting to let things simply bounce off his skin. However, when the wrong buttons get pushed, some claim he’s purposely holding back, his white, clenched knuckles and shaking hands a testament to barely contained anger. When Murphy is behind the mask, though, things change. On the ‘job’, all the contained rage and spite get put into his work, and he becomes a different man entirely; A man that Murphy wanted to stay buried. Physical Description: 
   Physically, at a glance, Murphy looks pretty typical for an athletic man in his early sixties. However, with a closer look, one could tell that, while he may be a little flabby looking in some places due to what the rejuvenation treatments and steroid cocktails couldn’t fix, he’s actually in a lot better shape than one would expect. His muscles are firm, his body doesn’t groan and crack when he moves, his joints don’t ache, and he can do some pretty dexterity demanding looking bartending tricks. He may not be an olympic athlete, but he definitely shouldn’t be counted out. Chrome/Implants: None. Fully, 100% Organic. Skills/Abilities:

“It’s a nice job, if you ignore the drunkards.”

   Bartending is Murphy’s current job, so he’s gotten pretty good at it. “A little birdie told me…”

   Rumor Spreading. As a bartender, Murphy is able to spread rumors pretty quickly. One specific rumor he likes to spread is of a lone merc up for hire. Little does anyone know, he’s talking about himself.

_ 
“You can always trust your bartender.”

      Not only does Murphy know how to keep a secret and an excellent liar, but he knows how to talk around people, and even get them to tell him things. This also works in getting people off his tail. “You never forget how to do what they taught you | Beware an old man in a profession where men die young.”

     Murphy was a soldier. He was a soldier for two decades, and a contractor for another two. Despite how much he would love to just sit down and forget that part of his life, he knows deep down that killing, whether it be with a rifle, a knife, or even his hands, it’ll always be what he’s best at. “These fucking drugs’ll kill me before any gangbanger does.”

    Not quite as much a skill as the others are, but Murphy knows he can’t keep up with augmented people with just the body he has, despite being in the best shape he’s been in in decades thanks to rejuvenation treatments he won. So, instead, he takes drugs. A cocktail of something (Even he barely understands it) that, while it doesn’t nearly equal the effects of full-on chrome, it helps make up the difference enough to the point where he can survive, and hey, it even helps him put on some muscle. He just won’t be punching holes in concrete like some.

**MedusaCascade**: Weaknesses: 

“I’m too old to die young and leave a handsome corpse.”

Murphy is old. He knows this. Even with his rejuvenated and far above average athletic state, he’s still very well in his sixties, and drugs that make him stronger and faster for a short time aren’t going to stop that. Direct punches to places like his kidneys, liver, and head hurt more, he’s prone to worse bleeding due to thinning blood, he takes longer to heal. Things like this should be signs to him that he shouldn’t be forcing himself to live this hidden life, but he doesn’t have a choice. “Look, I know it's old, just give me ten minutes to reboot it. It’ll be fine, stop arguing with me.”

    Murphy uses old tech, stuff that was used in the 40’s. His Exo-Skeleton, for example. While it still does its job of amplifying his strength and allowing him to keep his endurance up, (alongside the Steroids), any experienced netrunner can easily bypass the outdated security systems and shutdown, reboot it, etc. And he adamantly refuses to upgrade it. He doesn’t like change. “Emergencies and jobs only, Murphy. Don’t grab it. You don’t need it.”

    The drugs Murphy takes aren’t without their drawbacks. Strength comes with a cost, obviously. It just so happens that the cost when the drugs wear off include, but are not limited to, Vomiting, Shakes, Fever, Pain, Night Sweats, Nightmares, Insomnia, Dizzy Spells, High Blood Pressure, Disorientation, Loss of Consciousness. Oh, and it's very addictive. Who doesn’t like to feel powerful? _ 
“‘Get some Chrome’? What the fuck are you talking about?”    

    Murphy refuses to update. The things he says, be it idioms, phrases, even jokes, tend to just confuse the newer generations within Night City. Even the way he dresses; Nice, Tidy, Functional. He stands out when he’s not in his gear. Growing up nearly a century ago will do that. And standing out in Night City, nine times out of ten, is almost never a good thing. “Techno-Phobe?

I’m not afraid of technology, numbskull. Just don’t feel like getting cut up by some… Weird doctor who lost his medical license ten years ago.”    

    Murphy is very much anti-augmentation. He isn’t even chipped, leaving him to be seen as odd, or even weird people out, or be laughed at. Not to mention the ease of life things being augmented has, such as being able to accept tips digitally. He’s just a stubborn old man refusing to update to the times, at least when it comes to augments. _ 
Weapons/Armor/Equipment: 
Everyday Stuff:
Dress Shirts, Pants, Shoes. Pistol for protection, nothing fancy. Merc/Fixer Job Gear:
1x Kevlar Suit
1x Automatic (Energy) Rifle
1x (Ballistic)Pistol
3x Frag Grenades

**MedusaCascade**: Important Shit For Balancing That I Need Help With 😠 :
2x Steroid-Drug Cocktail Injection Things for jobs. (Price per injection unsure at this time, will contact GM. Increases strength and endurance.(When combined with Exo-Skeleton, just below or at ‘standard’ augmented strength levels(? Need to speak to GM.))


1x Aged Exo-Skeleton (with built-in hand spike in left hand.), Increases Strength, Speed, and Endurance. (Can be hacked. When combined with Drug Cocktail thing, just below or at ‘standard’ augmented strength levels(? Need to speak to GM.).)
-
1x Ballistic vest, Arm Guards, Shin Guards
1x Ballistic ‘?’-rated full seal helmet with HUD, NVGs. 1x Aged Wrist-Mounted Military Computer. Slower at hacking, harder to detect, but has poor network defenses for itself.) 
Backstory:

    Keith M. Murphy was born to Angie and Antonio Murphy on August 8th, 1985. Growing up in Cold-War era Boston, Under the Big Four’s Government, was rough on the boy, joining an Italian gang by the ripe age of 15. Murphy wasn’t a bad kid, just didn’t know what he wanted to do with life. That is, until the Big Four’s Government decided that a war- No, an invasion was exactly what they needed to solidify their rule. Murphy, at the age of seventeen, was drafted by the U.S. Army in 2002, as the U.S. Prepare for war. He didn’t get sent to the infantry, though. Due to Murphy’s extensive, and somewhat violent, criminal background, he and others with particular sets of skills were selected from his school to be planted within the U.S. Army’s Seventh Special Forces Group, and were sent to South America to do the Big Four’s bidding. New Vietnam, Murphy and the others called it. It was a shitshow, trudging through South American Jungles, killing in the name of a Government that didn’t give a rat’s ass about them.

Things like the Houston Incident, The Drought of ‘98, and other incidents were constantly on Murphy’s, and the others’, minds as they waded through mud, shit, and blood for the Big Four. And they lost. The war was a shit show. Thousands upon thousands of US Soldiers lost, and they only got the Panama Canal out of it. Murphy, like the entirety of the U.S. Military, were furious. Seven- Almost eight- years of wading through mud and blood, bleeding and dying for the gangs that ran the country, and for what? A water passage? Then, when the rest of the Military left, the government abandoned all their civilian Contractors- Hundreds of Thousands- in the Canal. The Nomad March of ‘10 ensued a few months after. What Murphy didn’t tell anyone, was that he and the others of the 7th SFG left New Vietnam a year earlier to prepare for a disguised attack on The Crystal Palace, A Space Station meant for the rich and powerful, for the FIA, his unit having been taken over by the agency covertly and permanently. Only twenty-three years old, and disguised as a terrorist, Murphy and the others boarded a ship inbound for the high-end space station. It was a massacre. Murphy, and less than fifteen others that weren’t captured, barely made it back to their ship. And the Palace dropped a fucking meteor off the coast of DC, in retaliation.

**MedusaCascade**: The following month after getting home was a blur for him and the others. The thing he knew, however, Murphy and the rest of the US ARMY 7th SFG were kicking down doors for the FIA, hunting down and executing remnants of the Big Four that escaped the reforms in 2008. If you can get him to talk about it, he’s likely to say something along the lines of ‘he doesn’t remember’. Likely due to the amount of experimental drugs the FIA had them on to keep them awake and fit for combat. Things calmed down after he got home, at least, until the states seceded from the Union, and then, for those “Free States” everything collapsed. Murphy watched from the outside as chaos reigned in those places, people turning on eachother, gangs gathering power. It horrified him. Unfortunately, He was called in to exercise Martial Law. Fast Forwarding to 2020, and Murphy was doing Covert Operations against the EEC in Columbia. When he got back in 2021, however, he retired. A favor had been owed to him by someone in the FIA, and he used it to not only get an Honorable Discharge, but a contract as, essentially, a privately contracted soldier in Militech. And it was good for him, a well paying job for far less danger. Until Arasaka began launching attacks on Militech operations, and they retaliated. Not even a year of peace was allowed to Murphy, now thirty-six, before he was engrossed in another war, and this time, it was privatized. Raids on and firefights with Arasaka forces were extremely common in the fourth Corporate war. He wasn’t inside Arasaka tower when it blew, obviously, or he wouldn’t be here. Although, until 2025, he was contracted by the US to quell Arasaka’s forces. After Murphy’s time in Militech, things settled down, and for once in his life, things were calm.

By 2060, Murphy was seventy-six, and had been serving as a bartender for about thirty-three years, since 2044, living through every major event since then (Such as the unification Wars), as a simple bartender. He even had a partner for two decades while he made ends meet with his job as his body and mind aged, becoming more decrepit as, eventually, by 2073, he was forced to retire. But then, something odd happened. Murphy, in seemingly one last stroke of luck, won the lottery in 2075, at ninety. Not just any lottery, mind you. A rejuvenation treatment lottery, as part of a marketing campaign by none other than Arasaka Industries. They promised to return his body to his prime, and all he had to do was sign the dotted line! In his aged state he didn’t hesitate, as the man was, though he’d never admit it, afraid of death. And it worked! By the fourth treatment, Murphy’s mind was back, and so was his body. He felt strong, fast. He felt like he could take on the world once more, another fifty to sixty years granted to him with just these four treatments, and he had four more to go! But then they gave him the bill. They had tricked the feeble old man when he could barely write his name, with a contract. In order to get the next, final treatments, which he had already started, he had to pay them off. Arasaka took the liberty of draining his bank account to start paying for them, knowing there was no way he would say. He did his best to make the money by returning to bartending, entering the employ of a young woman named Valley at “The Black Den” in Night City, but with the meager salary he makes there, it wasn’t nearly enough to pay off the debt he owed to Arasaka, his old enemies, though he still has the job. The pocket money was nice, after all. With this in mind, Murphy, as much as he hated it, as much as he enjoyed a life of peace, did the only thing he could think of to make money. He started fighting again. Not for a Country. Not for an Agency. Not for a Company.
For himself.

**MedusaCascade**: Additional Notes:

    Murphy keeps his lives as a bartender and soldier-for-hire separate, doing his best to prevent anyone from figuring out his identity when he’s on the job. Thankfully, being fully organic, not even chipped, helps with this. He’s not afraid to kill to keep that secret, either. What I need Help With

    Figuring out what the point cost for both the Exo-Skeleton, Helmet, and Drugs would be on the Cybernetics scale, and finding a substitute(s) for Cyberpsychosis, since Murphy is Organic. Am I underbalancing any of the items? Overbalancing? TBA?
**MedusaCascade**:
**MedusaCascade**: FULLY ORGANIC no cyberwear

**MedusaCascade**: Name: Athleta Jacksawn (Jacks)
Age:36
Pronouns:They/them/he/him
Occupation:Private Doctor/ Former Cybernitic Repo-person
Psychological Profile:Logical, Cocky, Greedy, 
Physical Description: Short lean build 
Chrome/Implants:
-Cybernetic mutli tool for surgical field work in Left hand and fore arm 
-optics enhancements for quick medical diagnosis, It was installed  by the company he repo’d for to find the parts but have caused him to see cartoony things that can be distracting, 
-artificial right leg for..walking lol 
Skills/Abilities:Quick with cybernetic install and removals, Charismatic
Weapons/Armor/Equipment: Reinforced Muscular fibers  
Character Concept/ Back story: Athleta Jacksawn  (Jacks), was in their final year of med school for cyber augmentations and anatomical repairs to pay for the school Jacks was stealing cyber parts from the company Gene co. where they were interning but jacks got caught on day and made a deal to repossess their product from people that didn't pay on timewhich was working out until the long night started to affect them to where they missed classes too much and rumor of their work started to hit the campus, forcing Jacks to drop out and be a fulltime repo doctor (medic049)
The money was good and jacks was nearing the end of their debt until he saw on the news the company filed bankruptcy and got absorbed onto the bigger company (insert company name here).

Jack asked about his job to people that worked and learned he was a blacklist employee they had cut any ties they had with him and was out of a job that never officially existed perse
    A few months past and jacks is homeless watching over their shoulder for enemies wanting revenge for the “legal” murders jacks did for work, he takes on little job of medical work for the poor being repaid with a meal here and there and the occasional roof to sleep under, then a message comes in about a desert clinic in need of a simple doctor, jacks travels out and meets old man Grembley that sent out the message and helps him setup the clinic there wasnt much but i felt nice to have a little peace for once. One day 5 cars all rush the shop and a group of thugs called the Dune Dogs burst out and rush the place, looking for any doc that could help....MY GRAMPS!!!! Jacks ends up saving this gramps fellow’s life and getting him healed, but all while Jacks was operating on him he was awake. And Gramps would talk Jacks’ ear off, talking back and forth slowly becoming friends overtime,after the operation and all the Dune dogs watching, cheer and wag their tails at seeing Gramps would pull thru, the old man thanks Jacks for his work and offers jacks an opportunity to be their ranks , be a Dune dogs, ba the designated doctor and have a home
And before Jacks can answer, Grembley yells out "Yes they are!" As they smile at ya, showing that they want Jacks to move on. Grembley says that this was too much for their old heart and they thought it would be best if they just made their clinic into a shop for meds. Less stressful that way.

And thus Athleta Jacksawn (Jacks) Joined the Dune Dogs 
Core Concept: Living the Rich life
Role: Underground cyberware dealer and repossessor,Cybernetic surgeon, street doctor, 
Core Drive: get rich, live comfy, and possess the best cybernetics 
Personality: Cocky, Confident, Professional, Greddy, Loyal to those they find useful and always thinking of new scams, will “fangirl” at newer cybernetics
They act cocky in front of others but if they failed to save someone on their table for what ever reason they would cry in private, they always try to act confident but if the bullets are flyin they might be running or talking their way out of it 
Cyberware: forearm and hand augmented with multiple tools for surgical work, neural overlays for instant diagnostics, reinforced muscular structure to pull out “parts”

**MedusaCascade**: Connections: Dune Dogs, Fixers, mercs, corpo defectors, and street thugs who need cyberware or medical care off the books. Conflict:  
-Short sighted in big decisions, 
-Constantly Teetering between their greed and desire to help
-Monetary gains are always a motivator but a danger in corrupting their moral to help those who really need it 


 How They Interact With Others:
They offer medical care, cyberware upgrades, and emergency patch-ups to anyone in need 
They sometimes sell illegal, experimental or fake, cyberware, leading to risky encounters and anger customers. More encouraged to work by profit
Jacks runs a shady side business called Second Chances, a fake "brain-backup" service advertised through local fixers, ripperdoc flyers, and dark net chatter. The pitch? "For a modest fee, I scan your neural patterns and store 'em off-grid. You get popped? I’ll bring you back. Or at least... someone close enough."
In reality, it’s a total scam. Jacks doesn't have the tech—or ethics—for actual consciousness restoration. He’s just playing into the hopes and fears of desperate mercs and overconfident clients who think they’re too valuable to die. Sometimes he believes his own pitch. Most times, he’s just funding his chrome addiction and retirement dream and No one can call him out on it… because anyone who dies isn’t around to complain.

SmartEyes

**BoobaSpice**: **Name:** Vale “Tengu” Yamashi
**Age:** 29
**Occupation:** Fugitive Criminal - Netrunner
**Psychological Profile:** Extroverted, Shut off, Secretive. **Physical Description:** Slim, with experimental holographic tech for looks. Half-Exotic (Fox)
**Chrome/Implants:** Cyberdeck Mk.4 Arasaka, Neuroport, Self-Ice, Ex-Disk, RAM Upgrade, Monowire x2
**Skills/Abilities:** Hacking (Traditional), Hacking (Netrunning), Hand to Hand Combat, Stealth, Improved Hearing. **Weapons/Armor/Equipment:** Monowire, Smart Gun
**Backstory:** Vale is a Half-Exotic Japanese-Australian that grew up with a fascination with the Net, and that fascination never lost her. Born into Australia’s East coast, She studied abroad in Japan to become a Netrunner, an opportunity gifted to her after she learned a highly advanced level of C++ and META-LINGUA. As she arrived with no chrome other than her Neuroport, she came under scrutiny as “Poor” but she believed that extra chrome were crutches waiting to be swiped from under her. She looked for jobs across the two nations, but found nothing but people asking for “Experience”. So, she tried the “nobel” route, setting up her own systems and attempts at Dataforts. Even with these solutions, nothing worked. She ended up nearing poverty, and was approached by someone who she had never met before, but knew of her work. They sat for coffee and discussed the current job market, where this stranger offered her a position. A Netrunner. The promised pay was much higher than entry positions for corpos. She thought about it, but finally decided to take it. She took as many jobs as she could, and the pay didn’t come. Weeks past, and while she was thinking she was being scammed and now on a watchlist of some kind, her rent became due. It would put her in the red. A notification arrived on her phone as she sat in her dirty slum apartment. A wire transfer appeared with… Double what the job was supposed to give her. A text appears, “Hell of a job, choom.

Expecting more.”

And with that… A quiet life was never attainable again. She worked her ass off, finding information, getting paid, breaking systems, getting paid, deactivating bots, getting paid… Then a dangerous job came across. `Disable the Chrome of a Corpo Gronk named “Katashi Heishi” at 01:13 tomorrow night.`

The job went bad. While she was flawless in getting into the residence without alarm, the intelligence was dated and she came face-to-face with a child walking the halls. She did the unthinkable, knowing it was her or the child, and used her recently purchased monowire to garrotte the child. She finished the job, and went dark, hearing a buzzing of electricity and flash of light from the bedroom of the Corpo. The next day, news started circulating of the death of Katashi and his son, a writer and investigator for Nippon Daily. A large police lookout had started, and her face was plastered on her screen. She picks up her phone, and a barrage of texts she had ignored shine in her face, ordering her to get outside. She leaves her house, and is driven to a nearby civilian dockyard. Her driver, a masked individual, pulls out a tablet, in a secure voice call. Her employer explains that she needs to get as far away as possible, maybe never to return, and that if she looks back, she would never see the light of day again. She was given two duffle bags from the trunk, which contained a fake ID for Night City, A large stack of Eddies, a SMART gun, and food rations. And so started the long voyage. **Additional Notes:** Distrustful of Government authority figures, and Japanese people as a precaution of being snitched on. **Image(s): **

messages.content:
**MedusaCascade**: The Boondock Saint
Netrunner

Age: 38
Pronouns: He/Him/They/Them
Occupation: Netrunner/Hooligan
Psychological Profile: Minor anger issues, paranoid, but generally happy-go-lucky. At this point he sees life as more of a game or joke than something serious to worry about. Physical Description: 5'10, medium build, toned muscle, bit of a babyface that he keeps covered. cosmetic cybernetics on jaw and body
Chrome/Implants: Aesthetic Cyberware, Netrunner Suite Lv. 3 (5), Ice Layer (2), Smart Eyes (2)
Total Cyberware Points: 9
Skills/Abilities:  Can hack really fucking good. Decent combatant if it comes to that, which it almost never does. smooth talker. Weapons/Armor/Equipment: SGI Technologies Cyberdeck, Kang Tao Jian, Heavily modified M-179 Achilles(converted to lever-action)

Born into a Devil Rays aquatic Nomad family (a distant branch of the Thelas Nation operating around the Baja California peninsula) around the late 2030's, little Charles Sullivan, who would grow up to become The Boondock Saint, was on a computer before he could talk. In another world he may have been called an "iPad kid", in THIS one, baby, he was born to (net)run. In between ports, Charles was getting his education from the tattered remains of the Net as it existed outside of major cities. Sure, the Blackwall encircled all, but the infrastructure just wasn't there yet. From the moment he learned about Roche Bartmoss, he was fascinated. Why would someone tear it all down like that? what was the goal? Chaos? Reform? Reconstruction? Whatever the goal, he supposed it didn't matter, since he had to go on the run and vanished not too long after. Charles gathered all the information and education he could, learning every technique his clan's netrunners knew, and learning from anyone he could find in the port towns they would stop at for fuel or gear.

In his early teens, he began establishing crude Datafortresses in the settlements they passed through so the residents could have an easier time accessing what they needed to on the net. Mostly, this was just the awkward little website for the mom and pop tech store, or the new site that would let old man Jose order his groceries digitally, but it still helped the community and gave his little clan some good rep for bringing "The Digital Saint of the Backwater Boondocks" with them into port.. That was, of course, until Netwatch noticed him. The best and worst decision he ever made was when he allowed himself to be recruited by those suited up grey hat corpo pet netrunner wannabes in the mid 2060's. He thought they would be able to help him with his goal of reunifying the world through the Net and bringing back the ease of access from the 2020's, but alas, more and more of his time was spent going after his fellow netrunners who had the gall to hack some massive corporation and get away safely. Most of them didn't even attempt anything nefarious, th3ey just wanted to test their skill against the biggest baddest benchmarks out there.

**MedusaCascade**: One day in the late 2060's, he finally had enough. He'd just tracked down The villainous Netrunner that went by the handle x.X.x.Dawng.L0rd.6969x.X.x., who had recently had the gall to hack in and look at an internal memo in Arasaka's network (turns out it was the menu for the cafeteria for the week). As it turned out, it was an extremely talented kid, about 12, who just made a real bad decision. Charles had suggested just giving them a warning since that would likely scare the bejesus out of the kid and he'd go straight. His boss passed it up the chain, and the word back from Arasaka was to zero the culprit. He was ordered to kill a 12 year old kid. He decided there was no way he would do that, and anticipated how things would shake out from there he made a quick backup copy of the (at the time) bleeding edge software and demons at his disposal, turned his deck in for maintenance and grabbed a loaner from supply, while also secretly socking away a (at the time) brand new top of the line cyberdeck behind the door panel of his car (an old habit from his Nomad days. it never hurts to have a secret compartment or two). When he went to his boss and refused to murder a child, he was mocked, berated, beaten, searched, nearly executed, and obviously fired. Ultimately, the kid was still killed by a (now former) coworker. Trauma Team showed up to get him to a hospital, but his coverage was cancelled en route and they dropped him off in a gutter. Luckily this was near a ripperdoc's place, so he was able to crawl his way in and not die. He spent the next couple weeks in traction, pondering what his next move should be. After he recovered and spent a majority of his savings paying the ripperdoc, and then sold most of his possessions to get the money to get his car out of impound, he decided a little payback was in order.

He remembered his old title from back in the day, started using the handle 'The Boondock Saint", and spent the next decade playing digital Robin Hood, plundering megacorp regional or district Datafortressesand selling the pilfered intel to  the highest bidder, usually a rival megacorp, and using the proceeds to boost his kit, keep his car running, and help out the smaller settlements in the wastes between cities. In his off time, he would also remove netrunners from the game that were causing unnecessary problems, burning out their net access or their brains. He finds himself thinking about Bartmoss more often nowadays, and he thinks he gets it. It wasn't about the chaos, the destruction. It wasn't about reform or reconstruction. It was about the freedom. Breaking the digital chains the megacorps had put on us all. but now they were being reforged. He just hoped he could use his aging, though still pretty preem equipment to cause enough trouble to keep everyone free before they were done. His last major score before making his way to Night City was a Zetatech R&D Facility, they'd nearly finished work on an upgrade to their Personal Ice system called "ImmunoAid Plus", slated for release in 2078. As it turns out, it was just a few lines of code that could be inserted into any ice hardware that would increase it's efficacy at detecting intrusion. His plan is to give Zetatech a long hard fucking by releasing it as freeware through every Ripperdoc he can contact. What better way to make a name for himself in Night City than to be That gonk that's way too generous? (IC it would be the reason people with personal Ice can suddenly see why they're being hacked or it would do nothing mechanically but increase security for flavor)

**BoobaSpice**: Good Boy Dallas - Character Sheet

Basic Information
Name: Good Boy Dallas
 Age: 21
 Pronouns: He/Him
 Occupation: Dancer, Joytoy (Club Hologram)
 Sexuality: Openly promiscuous, but emotionally unavailable
 Alignment: Chaotic Neutral
 Drugs: Psychedelics (for fun and escape)

Psychological Profile
Lover, Not a Fighter: Avoids violence at all costs due to past trauma and fear of becoming like his father. Daddy Issues: Haunted by his father’s violent legacy and death. Sees himself as weak in comparison. Escape Artist: Runs from responsibility, emotional attachment, and physical danger. Drugs, sex, and dancing keep him distracted. New to Night City: Still learning the ropes of the city. Can be naive but isn’t dumb. Attachment Issues: Struggles to let anyone get close. Has abandonment fears but pretends he doesn’t care. Self-Worth Struggles: Deep down, wonders if he’s just a product—just a body for others to enjoy. Physical Description
Build: Swimmer’s build—lean muscle, flexible, athletic. Species: Human/Dog Hybrid (Father was heavily chromed-out, rottweiler-coded Nomad; Mother is human)
Skin: Pale
Hair: Dyed frequently—color changes depending on his mood or just for fun. Eyes: Light, possibly enhanced with cyberoptics for aesthetic appeal. Style:
Lots of revealing, stylish, and androgynous clubwear—harnesses, mesh, crop tops, thigh-highs. Collars, chains, and small touches of neon cyberpunk aesthetic. Everything about him is designed to attract attention. Cyberware & Implants
Left Arm Cybernetic (Originally his father’s, now heavily modified):
Removed gun parts. No weapons, no heavy-duty combat mods. Dampened super strength. Doesn’t want to be a brute like his father. Taser hand. Can control voltage, used for self-defense (or client fun). Vibration function. Useful in his line of work. Blowtorch wrist. Originally for utility, now just for lighting cigs (and occasional fire dancing tricks). Sleek, dancer-friendly design.

Slimmed down to match his body instead of his father’s bulky frame. Likely chrome with neon underglow. Other Potential Cyberware:
Cyberoptics with aesthetic enhancements (color-shifting irises, subtle glow). Enhanced reflexes (so he can move better when dancing, not for fighting). Sensory tuning (maybe heightened pleasure responses or sensitivity adjustments). Skills & Abilities
Fire Dancer: Skilled in dancing with fire, spinning torches, and pyrotechnic tricks. Lap/Gogo Dancing: Makes people feel like they’re the only person in the room. Sleight of Hand: Used for teasing clients, pickpocketing small things for fun, or performing tricks. Cyberware Tinkering: Not a full-on techie, but knows how to mod his own cyberware for self-expression. Escape Tactics: Knows how to disappear when things get dangerous. Always has an exit plan. Weapons & Equipment
Left Arm Taser Hand: Used for self-defense or client fun. Hidden Blades in Boots: Just in case things get ugly. Never wants to use them. Psychoactive Stash: Carries small amounts of party drugs for himself or high-paying clients. Fashion as Armor: He relies on charm and looks instead of physical armor—but that doesn’t mean he’s defenseless. Backstory
Nomad Upbringing: Born into a Nomad clan that specialized in hijacking corporate shipments. His mother tried to shelter him from that life, but his father was a brutal enforcer who expected Dallas to follow in his footsteps. Sheltered but Tempted: Grew up around older Nomad kids who introduced him to partying, fire dancing, and stories of Night City. His Father’s Death: His father was gunned down in a raid, right in front of him. This trauma solidified his fear of violence. Pressured to Become a Fighter: After his father’s death, the clan expected him to pick up a gun and take his place. The Breaking Point: When the clan leader planned a heist on a high-risk corporate delivery, Dallas realized he couldn’t do it. The night before, he stole a dirtbike and ran.

**BoobaSpice**: Arriving in Night City: Free and exhilarated, but also completely unprepared. Club Hologram: He used his charm and skills to land a job as a dancer and joytoy. From there, he built his new identity—fun-loving, carefree, untouchable. Speech Style & Personality
Flirtatious, playful, and always teasing. Uses charm as a defense mechanism. Never lets people get too close emotionally. Nicknames for everyone: sugar, baby, gorgeous, handsome. Deflects deep questions with jokes or flirtation. 🔥 Stock Phrases & One-Liners
"Baby, you keep looking at me like that, and I might start thinking you’re in love."
"Love’s bad for business, babe. But I’ll make an exception if you make it worth my time."
"You’re looking at me like I’m a mystery to solve. Trust me, I’m much more fun unsolved."
"C’mon, let’s settle this like adults—by you buying me a drink and me pretending I don’t hate it."
"Oh honey, let’s not do the whole tough-guy act. You’re way too pretty to scowl like that."

Potential Story Arcs
Forced to Fight: A situation arises where running isn’t an option. He has to choose: fire a weapon, or let someone he cares about die. Facing His Trauma: The flashbacks get worse after a violent encounter, forcing him to confront his past, his father’s death, and his own fears. Making the Cyberarm His Own: He finally modifies the arm completely, turning it into something that represents him instead of his father. Breaking the Cycle: He meets someone who genuinely cares about him, but he has to decide—does he open up, or keep running forever? Reunion with His Mother: Whether accidental or intentional, he’s forced to face the woman he left behind. Does she forgive him? Does he forgive himself? Character Hooks for RP
Past catching up: Maybe a nomad from his old clan finds him and wants him back (or wants revenge). A dangerous client: Someone too powerful, too obsessed, or too violent. Can he escape?

Love isn’t part of the job: He catches real feelings for someone—but will he let himself? Drugs stop working: He starts realizing he can’t party the pain away forever. Fixer trouble: A fixer offers him a deal that could change everything. Does he take it? TL;DR - Who is Dallas? A fire-dancing, flirtatious, cyberpunk himbo with daddy issues and a taser hand. He’s sexy, charming, and fun, but underneath it all, he’s just trying to forget where he came from. A lover, not a fighter—
 but what happens when he doesn’t have a choice?

**MedusaCascade**: **Name:**Hawk

**Age:** Early Thirties

**Pronouns:** Masculine

**Occupation:** Edgerunner

**Psychological Profile:** 
EXMODE: (41) Friendly/Helpful 
INMODE:(97) DISORDER:(43) Agoraphobic 
Quirks: (96) Honorable (06) Eccentric (74) Musical
While on the outside Hawk is friendly and often too eager to help where he can, that augmented face truly does hide secrets behind it. One could call him eccentric and playing into his Exotic visage with bird like mannerisms and with how His eyes are constantly darting about the room. However in truth this is due to his ever careful nature and always planning an escape. Though should he fail to find one he might start making a scene. One might see him fidget and grow increasingly agitated especially if he is ever seated facing away from the entrance to a room. When excited or really agitated and trying to calm himself one might hear him start humming a tune or two. His past life constantly haunts him almost like a second personality calling him to remember the oath he had taken as a doctor. This gets worse should he ever have to kill someone. This leads him to try and find any sort of non-lethal approach to jobs. **Physical Description:** An exotic among even exotics with extensive reconstructive implants and replacements giving him the look of a walking talking hawk. **Chrome/Implants:** 
Experimental avian styled Bioware from Biotechnica including feathers, a beak full jaw replacement, avian styled hand and foot replacements. Quick hacking implants enhanced by his knowledge of implants. Ocular enhancements, low light vision, x-ray scanner able to help him identify certain implants. Prolonged use gives him terrible eye strain. In busy environments he can have difficulty focusing. Custom hidden forearm blades. **Skills/Abilities:** 
Quick hack
vision enhancements

**Weapons/Armor/Equipment:** 
His smart handgun named “Magic Missile,” 
Sharp Talons, 
hidden “Wing” blades in forearms.

**MedusaCascade**: **Backstory:**
“First, Do No Harm”
For Dr. Marstel, utterance of this oath for the first time was the happiest day of his life. It meant he had done it, he was a doctor now. And with it, soon he could help people, make a difference and earn a legacy that gave all the wealth and prestige he deserved for the hard work and sacrifice. That was then, now to Hawk those words were practically meaningless, nothing more than a nagging ache of a past life screaming desperately as his most recently orchestrated cyberware hack causes the internal CPUs in some attacking ganger’s arm chrome to fry and combust giving Hawk just enough time to make his escape. This past life, Dr. Marstel was a bright new face just out of medical school when he was poached by Biotechnica to become a cyberware specialist with some of their exotic line of Bioware. A good start to earn some good eddies, who was he to pass up a good deal. He could work with them until he could set up his own practice. Finding he excelled with cyberware installation, when he finally made his own way he instead took up as a ripperdoc offering services specializing with ocular, protective, and countermeasure chrome. Now he liked to say he held a reputation on the straight and narrow of a law abiding clinic, however when a man in a suit with six mercs holding irons to your face politely asks you to install some black tape level preem chrome behind his eyes, who was he to say no. How was he supposed to know the tech was swapped by some sneaky edgerunner a few days before? How was he supposed to know that man would suddenly go cyberpsycho in the middle of a back street weapons deal. He was just an unfortunate soul caught up in the middle of some high ganger politics and like most loose ends would find his story pruned before it could blossom. Of course that was only partly true. Word travels fast but not quite fast enough.

Caught in the process of hastily packing his medical equipment, two of the mercs suddenly blew open his door with irons red, spitting fire and fury. Had Dr. Marstel not dipped into his own supply and self service from time to time he would have flatlined then and there, however a lucky quick hack and some protective dermis in his arms were just enough to barely survive the first salvo that wrecked him as he cut and ran. Close to flatlining with his stims running out, by a miracle he made it to an old work choom and fellow cyberware specialist from Biotechnica before collapsing. He needed to disappear so with favors cashed as payment for exotic reconstructions to replace his destroyed jaw, hands, legs, and Identity. Unfortunately cashed Favors can only go so far, so he has a serious debt to repay. His friend knew a Fixer that could help him with some basic level job but he would have to start getting his hands dirty. While he can't go back to his old life lest he be discovered, he did learn a lot more about the software of cybernetics rooting through them while putting them in people's guts. Knowledge of hidden backdoors and security vulnerabilities that unlock some nasty surprises inside an enemy could prove useful. And he did need the eddies, he literally can't afford to be picky with work and repossession of his chrome would mean discovery. So Dr.Jefferson Marstel's story would end so that Hawk's could start in its place. A new identity, a new story to be written over the pages of what was. Now if only he can keep the old text from bleeding through. He just might survive.

**MedusaCascade**: **Additional Notes:**
Teamer edgerunner trying to make enough eddies to survive and pay off his debt to Biotechnica.(amount of debt to be determined)
Friendly but secretly really Paranoid

Relationships

Reil- Past Coworker a Biotech specialist still working at Biotechnica. It owed a lot more than just Eddies for their help saving Hawk’s life. Is one of the few people that knows Hawk’s true identity. Biotechnica - Previous employer he just might still have access to their facilities. Mafia - Totally am clean with these folks and totally not secretly a Ripper doctor that they think they killed a little while ago. Growth potential and knives. A knife is a piece of personal lore(usually negative) that can be twisted by storytellers to add drive and reaction to a character. Still coming to terms with how different his life turned out. His dream of being a doctor and helping people was shattered. How much of a life can he put together with the pieces? Will he find some other way to help people? Will he return to his past life? He was a good ripper doctor. But the fact that his last patient went cyberpsyco after he installed an implant haunts him. Did he make a mistake? It’s a question he asks himself all the time. What would he do if he heard a rumor about a chip that was stolen from said mafia before that operation? Who knows what he would do if he found the edgerunner that stole that tech. He’s gotta get eddies to pay off his debt. Riel got him a connection to Fixer to start some work. How will he take to such a different lifestyle? He probably will react poorly should he have to kill someone. “First, do no harm” after all.

**MedusaCascade**: Name:Eris [Original name Unknown.]
Age: 23
Pronouns: They/Them
Occupation: Merc
Psychological Profile:
Eris seems to be suffering from an obsession with silence to the point of violence, [They seem to resist their impulses very well] Seems to be on the edge of psychosis at all times. Extremely soft spoken
Physical Description: An novabeast Exotic with some abnormally long fangs as a result of a botched job. Their hands seem to be coated in dried blood but their cyberware implants are surprisingly clean. Chrome/Implants:
Netrunner System Level 2
Cyberlegs[Runner]
Monowire
Silent Step soles
Total Cyberware Points: 9
Skills/Abilities: Musical ability, manipulation
Weapons: Throwing Knives, Guitar, Sig Spear
Armor: N/A
Equipment: Not much
Backstory:Born to a affluent corpo family, Eris had all expectations of having a good life and they did until about 7 years of age when they were forced into developing a musical skill and as it turned out: they were a prodigy. Immediately, Eris' parent's used their connections for a trainer to nurture those nascent skills, however this trainer had other intentions in mind for the young child. Using the resources of their parent's the trainer did their job for another 3 years. All the while money changed hands and favors were traded until the fateful night when Eris went missing. [Remains unseen for about 3 years while the managers condition and chip the youngling.]

Fast forward about five years, Eris lays strapped to a table getting theirnext set of implant upgrades. Considering the shows he was doing as a stage concert/freakshow oddity,[plus it helped the manager keep their true identity a secret from the masses]. Their new manager was raking in eddies hand over fist, they rarely got a break. They were in constant pains as their body grew and implanted to become an Exotic, using synth mods for the act freakshow.

Combined with the artificial growth hormone for height, this resulted in them having canines larger than usual. Another two years later, it all comes crumbling down as Eris was running from show to show with not much time to take their meds, this unfortunately resulted in the death of one the primary managers and the new bandmates in a psychotic break. They adored the silence that came after the kill after years and years of noise, shows and stress, however they couldn't bask in the glorious silence just yet. They had to move. Having grown complacent and comfortable Eris' compliance over the years, Eris managed to find the manager's cred chit. They were paranoid the corpos would take it from their account so they kept it on a chit that couldn't be accessed unless inserted. However beyond that? There was no real protections because the guy was an idiot. They sold their old show based chrome, the ones with actual function and replaced it with some more... malicious and useful cyberware. For the next three years, Eris would live on the seedier underside, doing whatever they could to survive. With old managers looking to put Eris back on show and the trainer who wants their investment back along with the chit they carry. Eris lives looking over their shoulder 
Additional Notes: Description given is based on final texture not current texture. Expect to change and be reupdated with a new photo.

**MedusaCascade**: Name: Juniper "junebug" Mcleary
Age: 25
Pronouns: she/her
Occupation: solo/driver
Psychological Profile: calm and collected behind the wheel, makes decisive choices in intense moments
Physical Description: 6 foot even, 175LBS, slim but busty, sleek fur

Chrome/Implants: targeting optics, netrunner suite (level 1), dermal plating
Total Cyberware Points: 6

Skills/Abilities: ex-racer, good with knives and driving, has the ability to use her eyes to plan out routes and make split second decisions

Weapons/Armor/Equipment: butterfly knives, throwing knives, always well stocked, a nice and fast vehicle, no armor, she stays in the car normally

Backstory: Juniper grew up in the badlands around night city to a nomad group called "the burnouts" this nomad group was known as the best racers out there and Juniper was mentoring under their clans chief to be the next head of the clan, it was her first race day when everything went south, she had prepared for the day since she was little, ready to earn that title, but as soon as she turned her car on, chaos erupted around the track, her engine exploded, leaving her near death and burned beyond recognition, there was gunfire and screams as a rival clan "the dusters" attacked, intending to take down her clan, many were lost but the burnouts managed to fend them off, leaving both clans weakened and dying out, in a last ditch effort to save his pupil the chief of the fading burnout clan took juniper to many different docs, having her augmented into an exotic to give her an edge physically, having parts of her body repaired and replaced, her burnt skin swapped for synthetic fur, her eyes blind and black replaced with the highest tech of visual aids, and her brain getting a direct neural link to her vehicle so she knows if it's been tampered with, and with all those augments complete over the years, the clan had all but disbanded, leaving juniper and her old chief alone, roaming the roads until the day he died, but
when he passed he gave her one final gift, told her about night city and that she was free from the clan to do as she pleased, live her own life, and so once she buried him, that is where she went.

Additional Notes: juniper suffers from trauma around guns and fire, but behind the wheel of her car she's determined to make a living like her chief wanted, now she works as a hired driver, getting whoever pays her out of sticky situations, racing through the streets and keeping her clients alive are her top priorities.     Interchangeable eye colors depending on mood or aesthetic
    Mechanical body (light armor) with flexible frame and alluring anthropomorphic curves
    Style: A blend of luxury and comfort—flowing silks, glossy synthetics, and playfully revealing cuts. Often mistaken for a dancer or escort before she speaks. Cyberware & CWP:
Implant    Type    CP    Notes
Full Exotic Body Conversion    Misc    –    93% of body replaced (not CWP-tracked due to aesthetic-only conversion)
ICE Layer    Neural    2    Detects incoming quickhacks instantly. Emits weird static near devices. Internal Holophone    Neural    1    Allows voice calls, music, and limited AR communication internally. Basic Chipslot (with chiplock)    Neural    1    Can read datachips. Locked to prevent tampering. Total CWP: 4
Psychological Profile:

    Diagnosis: Insomniac, trauma-induced hypersexuality (self-described as “nymphomaniac”), compulsive validation-seeking
    Trigger Words (in reference to her): Toaster, Robot, Hollow, or any phrase implying she’s not a real person

    Behavioral Notes:

        Often appears confident and flirty in public, but is prone to sudden emotional shutdowns or withdrawal if emotionally wounded. Craves comfort, intimacy, and feeling “wanted” to counter the belief she’s more appliance than person. Deep down, she believes she should’ve died in the accident and grapples daily with feeling like a freak.

Skills & Traits:

    Exceptionally fast learner; good at adapting to social cues and reading people
    Resourceful, practical, and emotionally intelligent
    Good at collecting and passing on information—either intentionally or by listening quietly while people think she’s harmless
    Surprisingly resilient; survives by staying useful and desirable, but knows how to bite when pushed

Weapons & Gear:

    Armor: Her synthetic body acts as light armor (comparable to high-end leathers)
    Old Dogtown Pass Key: Occasionally helpful in locked-down zones
    Breathing Apparatus: Hidden in the body; filters low-oxygen environments or fumes
    Style: Often wears high-end or street-glam outfits with comfort-first tailoring. Minimal visible weaponry. Seduction is her defense—and fallback. Backstory Summary:

Born in Dogtown, Kelly had a rough early life. She barely escaped being Scav bait, only to suffer catastrophic injuries in a chemical explosion during a family outing. Only 7% of her original body remains; the rest is synthetic, leaving her a walking trauma case with a shiny coat of chrome. She attempted to die by refusing treatment—but found something… else. After discovering sex and attention could make her feel alive again, she pursued body upgrades, cosmetic augmentations, and work in the nightlife industry. Her goals were simple: money, comfort, survival—and maybe love. Her life is now one part hustle, one part escape. She uses her body and wits to carve a place in a city that still sees her as a fetish object or broken thing. She enjoys her work more than most would guess—but every once in a while, something cracks through.

**MedusaCascade**: Current Mental State & Goals:

    State: Struggling quietly. She’s fresh off a traumatic kill and trying not to let it derail her progress. Core Drive: Make enough money to feel safe—truly safe—for the first time in her life. Long-Term Goals:

        Make a name for herself beyond sex work
        Buy her own place
        Eventually feel loved without being owned

RP Flavor Notes:

    Her nickname “Holly” is her professional moniker—easier, sexier, and less vulnerable than “Kelly.”
    She is outwardly confident but can completely collapse if called “less than human.”
    Speaks with a slight “New York-lite” accent and sarcastic edge, despite her poised appearance. Prefers intimacy over combat and information over confrontation.

messages.content:
**MedusaCascade**: Name: Alan 'Owl/Weeping Crow' Autarch Jr
Age: 25
Pronouns: He/Him
Occupation: Mercenary For Hire 
Psychological Profile: Alan seems to be trained and focused but whenever his crow isn't around he seems to display some detachment issues. Physical Description: Alan stands at 6'1", lean but wiry — the type of build honed for speed over brute strength. His pale skin is crisscrossed with faded scar tissue, remnants of countless jobs gone sideways. Always wearing a Crow Mask Completely Hiding his face and muffling his voice to make somewhat unrecognizable. Chrome/Implants: Enhanced Ears, ICE Layer, Gorilla Arms, Netrunner Suite [Level 1]
Total Cyberware Points: 6 Points
Skills/Abilities: 
[Computer Intelligent]:  Understands the Language of Computers and Anything that is a device, Giving him an ability to run through it like it's his own computer. [Tone of Reflex]: With his Lean Build, He is able to move faster than normal. Weapons/Armor/Equipment:
[WEAPONS]: MK18, G17, Origin-12
[Armor]: Level 4 Plates Inside the vest, the Jacket being lined with Kevlar Fiber. [Equipment]: IVAS System [HUD System/NVG], ArmPad [Uses as Device/Hacking]

Backstory: 
Alan Autarch Jr. was born in the blistering dust of the Australian Outback, raised in the shadow of his father, Autarch Sr., a grizzled bush mercenary who made a name across the wastelands for taking the kind of dirty jobs corps wouldn't even dare whisper about. Sr. wasn't a noble man, but by God, he was good at what he did—and he taught Junior how to shoot, fix, and disappear before he ever learned to shave. At 12, Alan Jr. was riding shotgun on raids on outlaw nomads, scrounging crashed technology from corps convoys, and swapping bullets for water in drylands settlements. It was a raw, bloody childhood—one smeared in blood, motor oil, and dust storms. Sr. called it "schooling." Others called it endangerment of a minor. But out here, in the Outback Wastes, nobody much cared about laws.

By the age of 18, Alan Jr. was negotiating his own contracts, sometimes with his father—two Autarch's, double trouble. But cracks started to show. Jr. didn't always agree with the scorched-earth methods Sr. used, and after a Coober Pedy job went wrong, murdering an innocent family over a misread bounty, Jr. started questioning everything. Alan Jr. quit at 21 just like that. No great sendoff. Loaded a rifle, a backpack, and headed west toward the coast, after hearing rumors of where mercs might be able to get hired with discretion—the Badlands with along his Crow. The Badlands welcomed him like a brick in the jaw. Nomad packs, gangs, cyber-psycho raiders, and mutated wildlife forced him to adapt or perish in a hurry. Alan was made of sterner stuff than most, though. He made a name for himself building a reputation for fixing trouble on the down-low—taking bounties, running solo jobs, and navigating the wacky politics of nomad clans and fixer-run settlements. And then there was Night City. Alan turned high-risk at 23 to guard a data-smuggler across the border. It was a firefight, a car chase, and an explosive crash in Pacifica—but he lived. There was something about the neon chaos of the city that called to him. It was crazy in a different way. Grime with chrome taking its place, raiders replaced by corps, but the game? No difference. Now 25 years old, Alan Autarch Jr. is making a name for himself in the underworld of Night City. He's a free agent merc—deadly precise, and quieter than a ghost when required. Word has it he has connections with nomad clans in the Badlands and still wears some of the Modern Day Gear, mended with kangaroo skin and tribal burn scars. He doesn't talk much about his past. Doesn't talk much, period. But whenever he finds work, he's fleeing something—maybe redemption, maybe revenge. Or maybe just trying to prove he's not his father's son. Additional Notes: DON'T TOUCH THE CROW. Image(s):

messages.content:
**MedusaCascade**: Name: The Rippo Man, 
Age: 39
Occupation: Solo/Asset Recovery Agent
Psychological Profile: Not well. Sociopathic tendencies, anger management issues, sadistic. Physical Description: 6', trim, fit figure, scarred face, cybernetic arm. Chrome/Implants: Smart Eyes 2, Netrunner Suite 1, Cyberarm (Dexterity) 2, Cyberlegs 2, Cybernetic Claws 1

Skills/Abilities: Excellent MedTech skills, so a good doctor/surgeon and cybernetics engineer. Combat training from time on Trauma Team, some martial arts training. Weapons/Armor/Equipment: Integrally suppressed HA-4 Grit, Dao, electrified Combat Knife

**MedusaCascade**: Additional Additional Notes: By and large, when he's doing merc work, he doesn't try to justify it to himself. he knows what he's doing usually isn't good. As for when he works as a debt collector for ripperdocs, he fully justifies that as protecting them from the animals that would hurt them, the way he was hurt. He takes care of the dirty work so they can keep doing what they do helping people, being little heroes of their communities. he'll have been dealing with the sociopathy long enough to be able to mask decently well, so i should be able to play well with others. Backstory: From a charmed life as a Corpo brat to the rising star of the medical field, the child who would become The Rippo Man had such a bright future. Born in 2038 to the Junior Head Assistant VP of Inside External Sales of Militech, he had a pretty great childhood. He grew up a true patriot for the NUSA, his parents saw to it he wanted for nothing, and his education was second to none. He particularly excelled at anything science related, and eventually left for college to dual major in medicine and robotics. He performed his internship and residency at Night City Medical Center, but after a few years decided to step back do something less stressful. He decided to join Trauma Team. There he received extensive combat training before being assigned to a crew and sent out to save lives. He loved the work, but it started to wear on him just how badly some of their patients were injured by their fellow citizen, and he also realized that they only ever seemed to help out the financially aaffluent. After a while, he came up with an idea for his future. He would start up his own ripperdoc clinic specifically to help the less fortunate get the medical care they needed, while also maintaining a small supply of cybernetics to earn some extra eddies to keep the lights on. After a few years, he had earned himself a bit of prestige.

He had loyal patients and customers, had been featured in an article or two in the scream sheets for his philanthropy, Got a lovely little apartment above his clinic, and had even started doing well enough that he could start offering credit lines to those he could trust that needed chrome with the quickness. More often than not, they were good about making their payments, but there's always gonna be a deadbeat. One day, on the dozenth or so call in as many months to his own personal deadbeat asking about the debt, said deadbeat started getting heated, and stated he was getting sick of hearing from the good doctor, who responded in what he believed to be a joking way "Look, i'm sick of making these calls, too. if you can't pay for the arm, maybe we should just take it off you." The line disconnected, and a couple hours later, Deadbeat and his crew showed up to give the doctor "what he owes him", and promptly ripped the doctor's arm off. What followed was a beating that, combined with the blood loss, nearly took his life. Thankfully, the gang decided to show mercy and threw a tourniquet on him before lighting the clinic on fire.

**MedusaCascade**: Trauma Team showed up and brought him to the medical center, where he received top-notch treatment and a cybernetic arm. The fire raged, consuming his life's work and his home, leaving behind so much twisted wreckage. In the following months, his insurance would manage to find a way out of paying him, his clients would find new ripperdocs, and those that owed him decided that since the clinic was gone, they didn't need to pay. He had lost everything dear to him, and he just sort of... snapped. He too what little money he had left and had a couple augments made to himself, and gathered a list of those that failed to pay. He systematically hunted them each down and took back what he'd given them. At first he took care to not do any undue harm, but as the list got shorter, he started caring less and less. Once he had run through the list, he found he'd developed a taste for this type of work. He sold the cybernetics he had reclaimed and used the eddies to fund his start as a mercenary, with a particular emphasis on aiding ripperdocs and medical professionals above all else. He wouldn't let anyone else go down the way he had. Additional Notes: saw is not strong enough to use in combat, used for cutting through bone in surgery/ asset retrieval. Image(s):
