**MedusaCascade**: Name: Sarah Richard's
Age: 22
Pronouns: she/her
Occupation: netrunner
Psychological Profile: Prone to auditory hallucinations. mistrustful, minor paranoia and ghost pings. mood swings, insistent on checking surrounding
Physical Description: black hair purple highlights, red irises, black scleara, 5'9''
Chrome/Implants: chipslot, subdermal armor, ram upgrade  monowire (shocking dmg) Netrunner Suite (Level 1) Smarteyes icelayer mk2 Paraline cyberdeck: cyberwar malfunctions, ping
Skills/Abilities: Hacking, Quickhacking*, Data exploitation, diving
Weapons/Armor/Equipment:mk2 Paraline chip: cyberwar malfunctions, ping, monowire 
Backstory: Grew up in Japantown, Night City. Attended Schooling for Cyberspace knowledge and software design for a career in Militech. Following her sisters accident, attention from her parents grew far less frequent, mostly given to Kelly's mental and physical health. Sarah, in a fit of emotional abandonment, began to isolate herself and turned toward undefined cyberspace exploration and experimentation as a form of  catharsis. She turned out to be ahead of a few people in her community of peers, likely from the lessons at school. Not long after becoming more involved with these activities, her grades began to fall behind and her parents gave her a specific, more negative reaction than she'd hoped for. But it was something, and the raw Net was something that didn't feel so bleak and alone. Her initial dives were not so reckless, but as she began to get noticed by her family she became more interested in hanging out with netrunners outside of school, from the street who knew shit the class would never teach her. Like hacking basic auto vendors and tapping store links for secrets and selling the info. On a whim, and some additions of more unsightly company to impress, Sarah took a dive and ventured too the Blackwall with a small crew. After a few hours, a few of them dared her to touch it.

Maybe it was the lack of faith, or the peer pressure, or even the strange general thrill of such a dangerous idea. But she did. Upon doing so, her Brain was fried. All Cybernetics and software caught fire inside her body and she 'exploded', for lack of an accurate word. But she was lucky. Luckier than most in Night City have been upon making contact with the Blackwall. After multiple thousands of Eurodollars, three days of anxious waiting interspersed with lengthy conversations about remaining in a vegetative state for the rest of her life, and replacement of all necessary hardware and sever brain and muscle surgeries; Sarah woke up. Sarah was greeted with a mix of reprimand and unconditional gratitude. But she approached her miraculous recovery quite differently. She was withdrawn, emotionally scarred, and easily paranoid. After being discharged from the hospital, she receded and became less interested in diving for anything other than guaranteed safety and necessary work. Her memories were sometimes fuzzy, she was prone to losing focus, and sometimes claimed to hear noises that no one else could. But, her skills with the net were retained. In fact, in most of her work she found a certain simplicity where other runners would struggle. Had she remained interested in the career, she likely would have found promising job offers. However, due to life changes in environment and style, she found that working freelance offers and with Kelly's escapades, there were faster ways to make money and buy the Cyberware she wanted. It's been a few years since the Blackwall incident, and Sarah and her sister have recently moved closer too the area, interested in making a life for herself. Additional Notes:

**MedusaCascade**: Name:
Jay

Age:
29

Pronouns: 
He/Him

Occupation: 
Ex black-ops merc. How He Works 
(His Role in the City)
 Mechanic at a Low-End Garage (Deadbolt Auto)
A simple, blue-collar job that keeps him out of sight while giving him access to vehicles, street gangs, and underground clients. Modifies his own gear or swaps out stolen plates on getaway rides. (His Role in the Underworld)
Jay operates in the cracks of society, taking jobs that align with his skills and goals:

Extracting high-value targets (alive) for clients who pay well. Infiltrating corpo facilities to dig up buried secrets and sell them to the highest bidder. Hunting Omnitech assets, looking for clues about his past while sabotaging their operations. (Why he still works)
He knows he's good at what he does, and if someone is willing to pay him to do it, its easy eddies. Psychological Profile:
hyper-intelligent, paranoid, and driven survivor, torn between his need for vengeance, his struggle to maintain his humanity, and the addictive thrill of always being one step ahead in a world that wants him dead. Avoids emotional attachments, afraid that if he loses control, people around him will suffer. Physical Description:
Grey and black exotic. medium build. 5'11. Chrome/Implants:
1) Targeting Optic 
2) Scilent Step 
3) Chameleon Skin

Total 6 CWP

Skills/Abilities: 
mostly stealth and technical abilities. (tactical espionage) 

Weapons/Armor/Equipment:
His cloak is lined with counter-surveillance tech
Silenced pistol w Pax mod (non-lethal)
Electro net launcher
Smart bolas
EM Pulses



Backstory:

Jay - The Ghost in the System
In the sprawling neon jungle of New Eden, where corporate greed fuels the underworld and hackers fight wars from the shadows, Jay is a ghost. a name whispered in encrypted messages and hushed conversations. No one knows his true face. No one remembers his real name. But everyone knows the hooded figure with the glowing mask.

Jay was a promising netrunner working deep inside Omnitech Industries, a megacorp obsessed with control. He was part of Project ECHO, subjected to experimental brain-machine interface tech known only as the "OBLYVIAN drive", creating the ultimate corporate spy. But something went wrong. The drive gave him severe neurological damage that leads to migraines, flashbacks or sometimes blackouts. although Jay is well trained and enhanced, his experimentation makes him unpredictable, a liability. Jay was meant to be erased, but instead, he became something Omnitech never expected: a ghost in the machine, fighting back. Now, Jay is a ronin of the grid, his mask hides his identity while feeding him real-time data. He sells secrets, dismantles oppressive systems, and leaves behind a digital signature wherever he strikes, a neon fox symbol. the last thing his enemies see before their firewalls burn. But Jay knows the clock is ticking. The migraines and flashbacks cause him to struggle, and Omnitech hasn’t stopped hunting him. Every night, as he fades into the city's electric heartbeat, he wonders: is he still human, or just another ghost in the machine? Some Motive/Internal conflict

Jays mother, Nora was either abducted or killed during his experimentation with Omnitech. His flashbacks are distorted, showing him glimpses of his mother occasionally but never the full truth, seeing things like a hand reaching for him, a voice calling his name, or the flickering lights of a lab. Was she a test subject like him? Did she try to protect him from Omnitech? Was her fate erased from his mind on purpose? Every mission could bring him one step closer to the truth—or push him further into the mental chaos of his own fractured memories.

**MedusaCascade**: Knowing that these things only are happening because of the OBLIVION Drive, his flashbacks could be unreliable, mixing truth with distortion, making him question whether the memories he pieces together are real or manufactured lies implanted by Omnitech. Jay is in a constant state of doubt and paranoia. Every lead, every flashback, and every piece of information he uncovers could either bring him closer to reality or send him spiraling into deeper uncertainty. Defining Moment

As an elite netrunner under Omnitech Industries, Jay was a rising star, handpicked for an experimental cyberware implant called the "OBLIVION Drive". A cutting-edge neural augmentation designed to predict threats, process vast amounts of data, and enhance cognitive speed beyond human limits. Omnitech wanted to create the perfect infiltrator—someone who could see an attack before it happened, outmaneuver enemies, and manipulate systems with near-instant precision. At first, the implant was a success. Jay became faster, smarter, deadlier—a living supercomputer, executing black ops for Omnitech with chilling efficiency. But then, running on a neurochemical knife’s edge started to take its toll, when his implant started to show him things he wasn’t supposed to see—encrypted files, hidden directives, corporate betrayals. Through it, Jay discovered the truth: Project ECHO wasn’t just about creating agents—it was about controlling them. The experiments weren't just enhancing him; it was slowly overriding his mind, rewriting his thoughts, turning him into nothing more than an obedient drone. And he wasn’t the first. He had found files on others—test subjects who had “malfunctioned” when the implants pushed them past their limits. Omnitech’s solution? Memory wipes. Reprogramming. Disposal. Jay realized he was next. The night of his scheduled "routine maintenance", he made his move.

Using the very abilities Omnitech had given him, Jay tore through their firewalls, erased his digital footprint, and sabotaged their systems before making his escape. Since that night, Jay has been on the run, fighting to stay ahead of Omnitech’s assassins while searching for a way to permanently disable his connection to Omnitech. The OBLIVION Drive still makes him a deadly adversary, but with every use, he risks losing himself. One day, he’ll either take Omnitech down for good… or they’ll capture him and erase what’s left of him.

She was 17 when her abusive parents passed away and she was kicked by the house owner to the streets. After a year of suffering from hunger and sleeping on the streets a Mafia guy approached to help her (as she thought at first). She found herself in a slave market where clients gathered to please themselves and either buy/rent a slave, she suffered from being sexualized all the time and used and beaten up when she tried to fight back. She made a friend within the slaves but that friend didnt last long till they committed suicide, that brought her to a break down until one day a client approached carefully and they were very nice with her for the first time in her life. He fed her in secret and made sure she stays in touch with him, he couldn't buy her because of he reputation and his role in that city but he truly loved her and when he wanted to help her escape he got caught by the Mafia guy and his men were sent to start rumors and he lost his role and was killed.

After she heard about him she realized everything that tried to help her gets taken away everything that is nice to her gets hurt,got into a breakdown after breakdown until she crashed out and stole double Daggers from one of the mafia men that was asleep during his guarding duty and started a massacre at the Slave Market. Numb, cold, Yet smiling while enjoying the sound of tortured screams and cries. She let out all the slaves. headed to a Ripperdoc to give her oni horns and enhance her skills and abilities and the double daggers. She moved to Night City running away from her past wanting to start a new normal life after 2 years of being a slave. Now she is 20 years old And ready to be independent. Story Arcs:

Will she forget the pain she was in, will she finally move on? The Scar on her back might expose who she is and where she came from. **MedusaCascade**: **Name:** Zuri
**Alias:** Neon Viper, Street Phantom
**Age:** 36
**Pronouns:** They/Them
**Occupation:** Racer Mercenary (Katana Specialist)
**Total Cyberware Points:** 6

**Backstory:**: Zuri was born and raised in the chaotic streets of Night City, where survival was a game of speed, wits, and ruthlessness. Starting out as a street racer, she quickly became known for her unmatched skills behind the wheel, and for her ability to navigate the lawless, cybernetic-drenched world with ease. Over time, Zuri was recruited into mercenary groups, leveraging her expertise in high-speed chases, infiltration, and combat. Now, Zuri operates as a freelance mercenary, taking on high-stakes jobs that demand precision and cold efficiency, while also continuing to race on the streets for both money and status. **Psychological Profile:** 

### **Key Psychological Traits:**

1. **Adrenaline-Seeking**:  
   Zuri lives for the rush—whether it’s tearing down the highways in her customized vehicle or escaping a firefight with a bullet grazed past her skin. Her heightened adrenaline tolerance has shaped much of her behavior, leading her to thrive in high-risk situations. In fact, it's not just about money for her—it's about the thrill of the chase and the satisfaction of being in control of life-or-death situations. This drive pushes her to take on more dangerous contracts and races, testing her limits

2. **Emotional Guardedness**:  
   Zuri's life in Night City has taught her that emotions are a liability. Having witnessed the corruption of those around her, including betrayal by trusted allies and the brutal consequences of misplaced loyalty, Zuri is fiercely protective of herself emotionally. She keeps others at arm's length, often appearing cold, calculating, and detached. She trusts few people and relies on her own instincts, preferring the company of her vehicle or her weapons over that of any human connection. 3.

**Survival Instincts**:  
   Growing up in Night City, Zuri developed an acute sense of survival. She can read people and situations with remarkable accuracy, identifying threats before they even materialize. She’s able to stay calm and think strategically when most people would be paralyzed by fear or anxiety. This has made her a highly effective mercenary, adept at both navigating complex urban environments and understanding the machinations of the powerful factions that run Night City. 4. **Nihilistic Worldview**:  
   Zuri has a jaded perspective on life, shaped by the constant corruption, violence, and betrayal that defines the underworld of Night City. She believes that the world is controlled by the powerful, the corrupt, and the corporate overlords who manipulate the masses. In her mind, the struggle for survival is the only thing that matters, and morality is a luxury that few can afford. This nihilism manifests in her frequent disregard for the long-term consequences of her actions—she takes what she needs to get by, and doesn't concern herself with the bigger picture. 5. **High Competence and Confidence**:  
   Zuri’s greatest strength lies in her confidence. She knows that she’s good at what she does, whether it’s racing, fighting, or strategic planning. Her sharp intellect and relentless focus have helped her climb through the ranks of both the racing scene and mercenary jobs. While she might appear cocky to those who underestimate her, her confidence is not unwarranted—Zuri has earned her reputation, and she knows it. 6. **Self-Destructive Tendencies**:  
   Zuri's need for speed and her reckless approach to danger often veer into self-destructive territory. She’s not afraid to put herself at risk, whether in a high-stakes race or a life-or-death mercenary mission. This dangerous behavior could be seen as an outlet for her unresolved trauma or a deep-seated need to prove to herself that she can overcome anything.
However, it also makes her vulnerable to situations where the consequences could be permanent.

**MedusaCascade**: ### **Behavioral Traits:**

- **Strategic and Tactical**:  
   Zuri is highly tactical, whether she’s planning an ambush on a corporate convoy or plotting her next race. She analyzes the situation from all angles, quickly identifying her best opportunities and minimizing her risks. This is evident both in her mercenary work and her racing career, where every move is calculated for maximum impact. - **Hyper-Vigilant**:  
   Always on the lookout for threats, Zuri is hyper-aware of her environment. This paranoia keeps her alert and able to respond quickly to dangers. Her sharp eyes constantly scan for movement, potential ambushes, or any form of subtle threat—whether it’s in the form of rival racers, mercenary employers, or the corrupt corporate agents lurking in the background. - **Physically and Mentally Resilient**:  
   Zuri's ability to endure physical and mental stress is remarkable. Her years of racing have honed her reflexes, while her mercenary work has made her tough both emotionally and psychologically. In combat, she is fast and precise, able to outmaneuver enemies with ease. However, her resilience is also a double-edged sword, as it sometimes leads her to push herself too far, both physically and emotionally. - **Minimalist Communication**:  
   Zuri communicates succinctly, often with little fanfare or elaboration. She speaks only when necessary and prefers action over words. This, combined with her preference for solitude, makes her a difficult person to approach. She’s efficient, and she expects others to be the same. ---

### **Conclusion:**
Zuri is a complex and multi-layered character—part ruthless mercenary, part adrenaline junkie, part survivor. In the unforgiving streets of Night City, she’s learned to navigate life by trusting only herself and taking control of her fate in whatever way she can.

Her journey is one of survival, escape, and seeking a fleeting sense of freedom, all while dealing with the emotional and psychological baggage of a life lived on the edge. In the neon-lit chaos of Night City, Zuri is both a product of her environment and a force that refuses to be controlled by it.

**MedusaCascade**: **Physical Description:**

---
 
**Height**: 5'9" (175 cm)  
**Weight**: 150 lbs (68 kg)  
**Body Type**: Lean, Muscular, Athletic  
**Physical Appearance**: Zuri possesses a striking and athletic physique honed by years of rigorous training and high-octane lifestyle. Her body is lean and toned, with visible muscle definition, particularly in her arms and legs. Her frame is built for speed and agility, a necessary combination for both street racing and combat. Her movements are swift, calculated, and fluid, reflecting her proficiency in both high-speed maneuvers and precision strikes with her katana. ---

### **Key Physical Features:**

1. **Facial Features**:  
   Zuri has sharp, angular facial features, with high cheekbones and a strong jawline that gives her a fierce, almost predatory look. Her eyes are an intense shade of grey, often described as cold or calculating, giving her a piercing gaze that makes others uneasy. Her eyes are framed by dark, neatly kept hair that she often keeps pulled back into a tight ponytail to avoid distraction or kept short, though strands occasionally escape to frame her face. Her skin tone is like ivory, marked with a few battle scars from close calls and past confrontations. 2. **Hair and Scalp**:  
   Zuri's hair is jet-black with a slight sheen, kept relatively short at the back and longer at the front, often styled in a way that complements her utilitarian and tactical lifestyle. The contrast between the sleek style and her intense demeanor makes her look both professional and dangerous. Occasionally, she’ll add subtle highlights of neon colors—primarily deep reds, oranges, or electric blues—to match her racing aesthetic. 3. **Posture and Gait**:  
   Zuri walks with a confident, measured stride. Her posture is straight and unyielding, giving the impression that she’s always prepared for a fight, a chase, or anything that comes her way.

She holds herself in a way that reflects her resilience and self-assurance, neither slouching nor overtly aggressive. When in motion, whether running, driving, or walking, her movements are fluid, with a sense of precision like a predator on the prowl. 4. **Eyes**:  
   Her eyes, one of her most striking features, convey a cold intensity that gives away little about her emotions. They have a laser focus, always scanning her surroundings—whether on the street or in the midst of combat. When engaged in a race, her gaze sharpens, like a hawk focusing on its prey. In battle, her eyes can quickly assess threats and opportunities, calculating the best move in a split second. ---

**MedusaCascade**: **Chrome/Implants:**

### **Body Modifications and Enhancements**:

1. **Cybernetic Enhancements**:  
   Zuri has undergone several cybernetic modifications to enhance her physical abilities, many of which are integrated into her body to maximize performance both as a racer and a mercenary. - **Neural Interface/NetRunner Suite (Level 1)**: A high-tech neural interface allows Zuri to connect directly to her racing vehicle’s system, giving her near-instantaneous reaction time and perfect synchronization between her body and her car. This interface also enhances her combat reflexes, giving her a heightened sense of awareness in a fight. - **Enhanced Reflex Augmentations/Combat Wired Reflexes**: With an advanced reflex booster implant, Zuri’s reaction time is faster than any human without modifications. This allows her to execute flawless combat techniques and evade attacks with unparalleled agility. 2. **Arm and Leg Enhancements**:  
   - **Cyberleg (Runner)**: Zuri’s mucles have been augmented with reinforced musculature and subdermal plating, providing both enhanced strength for combat and better protection in the event of an accident. Her legs, in particular, have been enhanced for speed, which makes her an even more agile racer and a deadly combatant in hand-to-hand situations. Her movements are quick, with a natural grace and precision that belies her strength. ---

**MedusaCascade**: **Weapons/Armor/Equipment:**

### **Clothing and Gear**:

1. **Combat Suit**:  
   Zuri wears a custom-designed combat suit built for both speed and protection. The suit is sleek and form-fitting, made of flexible, high-strength materials that allow for optimal mobility. Its dark colors are complemented by subtle neon accents (usually blue or purple), matching the aesthetic of her racing persona. The suit incorporates impact-resistant plating in vital areas like the chest, back, and limbs, offering protection without restricting movement. 2. **Katana Sheath**:  
   A critical component of her gear is the katana she carries—an elegant yet deadly weapon. Zuri wears a specially designed sheath for her katana on her back, with a magnetic locking system that keeps the blade in place during high-speed pursuits. The katana itself is a razor-sharp, custom-forged weapon, modified with a few cybernetic enhancements that allow it to cut through tougher materials when necessary. The blade’s sleek, dark metallic finish is reflective of her overall aesthetic, adding an almost otherworldly quality to her presence. 3. **Gloves and Boots**:  
   Zuri wears specialized gloves designed for both racing and combat. These gloves are enhanced for grip, allowing her to maintain control over her vehicle at high speeds and offer protection during combat. The boots she wears are combat-grade, with reinforced soles for running, jumping, and standing firm in battle. They are lightweight yet durable, giving her the agility needed for both racing and fighting.

**MedusaCascade**: **Skills/Abilities:**

### **Combat and Racing Posture**:

1. **Racing**:  
   When driving, Zuri adopts a low, aggressive posture that maximizes control over her vehicle. She leans forward slightly, with her hands tightly gripping the wheel, eyes focused on the road ahead. Her body is always ready for quick movements—tuning into the immediate need for maneuverability, whether it's dodging an enemy or executing a dangerous turn. 2. **Katana Combat**:  
   Zuri’s katana skills are a product of years of discipline and training. Her stance in battle is grounded and fluid, favoring speed and precision over brute force. Her stance typically involves low, quick strikes and evasive maneuvers that allow her to swiftly close gaps or disengage when necessary. She maintains perfect posture while wielding the blade, with a fluidity that makes her appear almost as if she's dancing, except with deadly intent. In combat, she’s always calculating, never wasting a single movement. 3. **Martial Arts**:  
   In addition to her katana expertise, Zuri is trained in several forms of martial arts, including ninjutsu and jujutsu. Her movements are swift, and she’s skilled at disarming opponents or engaging in hand-to-hand combat if her sword is not an option. Her posture and technique are designed for efficiency and for exploiting the weaknesses in her opponents’ defenses. ---

**MedusaCascade**: ### **Physical Strengths**:

1. **Speed and Agility**:  
   Zuri is extraordinarily fast and nimble, both on foot and behind the wheel. Her speed in racing is matched only by her ability to swiftly move in combat, dodging incoming attacks and striking with precision. This agility makes her a formidable opponent on the battlefield and ensures her dominance on the race track. 2. **Endurance**:  
   Years of racing in extreme conditions and enduring brutal combat have made Zuri highly resilient. Her body can endure long hours of activity without tiring, and she can recover quickly from injuries—thanks to her cybernetic enhancements and rigorous training. 3. **Combat Proficiency**:  
   Zuri’s expertise with the katana makes her a lethal force in one-on-one combat. Her style blends the precision of traditional sword fighting with modern enhancements, allowing her to cut through most opposition with grace and speed. She combines her katana with her martial arts training, making her unpredictable and highly effective in a variety of combat situations. ---

### **Conclusion**:
Zuri’s physical profile reflects the blend of her high-stakes racing and deadly mercenary lifestyle in Night City. Her body is a product of constant training, cybernetic enhancements, and a drive for perfection. Whether on the road or in battle, Zuri’s physical attributes make her a lethal force to be reckoned with—both agile and powerful, with an innate ability to adapt to any situation. Her appearance alone signals danger, but it’s her physical prowess and mental discipline that make her one of Night City’s most formidable mercenaries.
**MedusaCascade**:

**MedusaCascade**: NCRP CHARACTER SHEET
Name: Reina "Wildcall" Arakawa
Age: 42
Pronouns: She/Her
Occupation: Arasaka Sales Representative / Corporate Asset
________________________________________
Psychological Profile:
Reina Arakawa is a woman who learned to survive in the corporate jungle through quick thinking, adaptability, and an unshakable poker face. Once an ambitious young accountant, she found herself climbing the ranks, one calculated risk at a time—until Arasaka decided to gamble with her life instead. She has perfected the art of appearing calm, even when cornered. Beneath the surface, however, she is riddled with anxiety, knowing full well that her current position is not due to talent alone, but because the corporation owns her. The botched Militech Minotaur deal was her trial by fire, and despite surviving, she carries the weight of that night in every interaction. Now, with a full-time corporate shadow watching her every move, Reina plays the part of an unshakable saleswoman, all smiles and sharp words, but her mind is always running contingency plans. She knows that to slip up even once would mean Arasaka removing her from the equation. One day, she hopes to get out. One day, she hopes to live for herself. But today is not that day. ________________________________________
Physical Description:
Reina is an unnervingly attractive woman, her cybernetic alterations sculpting her into a vision of predatory allure. Standing at 5'9", she carries herself with the practiced poise of a corporate elite. Her body is sleek, toned, and subtly enhanced—nothing too flashy, just enough to maintain effortless elegance. Her most striking feature, however, is her anthropomorphic appearance. After the failed deal with Maelstrom, Reina underwent extensive cosmetic augmentations, transforming her into an anthro-hyena hybrid.

A sharp muzzle, digitigrade legs, and spotted synthetic fur make her instantly recognizable… and nearly impossible to trace back to her old identity. Her yellow cybernetic eyes shimmer with predatory amusement, her elongated ears twitching slightly with every shift in the conversation. The alterations were meant to be a disguise, but now they are her brand—an Arasaka spokeswoman with the face of a beast, charming high-end clients while keeping lowlifes at bay. Her voice is smooth, velvety, with just a hint of a growl beneath the surface. ________________________________________
Cyberware:
Cyberarm (Dexterous)2ArmPrecision tool use. RP lockpicking, surgery, hacking.Weak to EMPs. Shakes when under pressure. Doesn't enhance Stamina
Enhanced Ears1MiscHear whispers through walls, filter sound, pinpoint origin.Overwhelmed in noisy spaces. Startles easily. Biomonitor1NeuralTracks all vital signs. Can auto-alert medtechs or partners when you're in danger.Can trigger false alarms. You get “pinged” constantly when anxious. Neurofilter2NeuralSuppresses emotions. Perfect in combat, negotiations, torture.Cuts you off emotionally. Others feel you're 'not all there.'
________________________________________
Skills & Abilities:
•Master Negotiator: Reina can talk her way out of (or into) almost anything. Whether it's cutting a deal, dodging a bullet, or selling someone their own wallet, her silver tongue keeps her alive. •Corporate Gambit: A refined ability to predict what people really want and manipulate them accordingly. Reads body language and vocal inflections with eerie accuracy. •Deadeye Marksman: Reina may not be a combat specialist, but when forced to fight, her HIB-MK33 Revolver speaks for her. Precise, deliberate, and ruthless—she never wastes a shot. •Unshakable Presence: Fear is a luxury she cannot afford.

Even in the face of disaster, she holds her ground, projecting an aura of control that keeps clients, enemies, and even Arasaka themselves second-guessing her true thoughts. ________________________________________

**MedusaCascade**: Weapons/Equipment:
•HIB-MK33 Heavy Revolver: A high-powered hand cannon with a chrome-plated finish, custom-fitted to her grip. It carries six rounds of absolute finality. ________________________________________
Weaknesses & Balancing Factors:
•Under Corporate Watch: Reina is never alone. Her assigned security detail, Bishop, is as much a protector as he is a leash. Arasaka will not allow her to act outside their interests. •Not a Fighter: Despite her skills with a revolver, she is no soldier. If things turn into a prolonged fight, she is at a severe disadvantage. •Psychological Strain: The trauma of the Minotaur deal lingers. Loud electric discharges, burning smells, or the sight of malfunctioning cyberware can trigger severe anxiety, threatening her composure. •Expensive Appearance: Her anthro augmentation is not just a disguise—it is a luxury. Maintaining it is costly, and Arasaka holds the leash on those expenses. ________________________________________
Security Detail: Sir Lazarus (Formerly Elias Kessler)
Age: 34 (Biologically) | Unknown (Post-Cyberization)
Pronouns: He/Him
Occupation: Arasaka Security Asset / Corporate Enforcer
Sir Lazarus is an ever-present shadow at her side—a knight in gleaming white chrome, bound by loyalty protocols and reinforced musculature. His red-tinted visor flickers with unreadable data streams as he scans every room, every face, every movement. His medieval speech patterns make him an unsettling presence, a relic of a failed experiment now repurposed as a personal bodyguard. Despite his towering, cybernetic frame, he moves with the grace of a warrior from a bygone era, ever vigilant, ever calculating. His duty is clear: protect the asset, eliminate threats, and ensure the corporation’s will is done. "Milady, thou art in peril—I shall carve thee a path of righteous steel!"
But beneath the chivalric obedience, something lingers. Memory glitches. Fragments of a past life.

And though his programming demands unwavering service, the cracks are growing. ________________________________________
Backstory:
Reina Arakawa was once a simple accountant—a numbers girl who knew how to navigate corporate ledgers. At 18, she entered Arasaka with dreams of security, of a stable career, of climbing the corporate ladder. And she did. By 35, she had transitioned into sales, leveraging her analytical mind and sharp wit to close high-profile deals. She was good at her job. She was loyal. But loyalty meant nothing when Arasaka saw an opportunity. A deal had gone bad. A Militech Minotaur mech, stolen, broken, outdated—meant to be dumped onto Maelstrom to erase loose ends. The original salesman was taken out by a NetRunner attack. Reina was the replacement. The deal spiraled into catastrophe. A Maelstrom lieutenant's son plugged directly into the mech’s neurolink—without safety dampeners. His skull ignited like a Roman candle. Screams, gunfire, and then—MaxTac. Arasaka knew it would go south. They wanted it to go south. They watched her stand in the fire, and when the smoke cleared, she was still breathing. Now, she is their investment. A rebranded face. A fabricated identity. A life owed to the corporation. Reina Arakawa is still climbing the ladder. She just doesn’t know if she’s going up… or if there’s only one step left before the fall.
**MedusaCascade**:

**MedusaCascade**: Name: Riley Watson

Age: 24

Pronouns: He/Him

Occupation: Private Investigator | Solo

Psychological Profile: A private investigator working as a solo after-hours to keep the lights on and to protect his wife, struggling with his conflict between his deep drive to protect and help the innocent and his morally ambiguous deeds and killings as a mercenary. Physical Description: Riley stands at about 5'11.5", with elvish ears and a mustache and goatee. Both of his arms are cybernetic, and he has a faint glow to his eyes due to his optical implants. Chrome/Implants:

Gorilla Arms (2 Points)

Gradiated Subdermal Plating (Discreet) - 3

Basic Cyberoptics - 1


Total Cyberware Points: 6

Skills/Abilities:
Proficient in CQC, espionage, assassination and intelligence gathering. Proficient with small-arms and sniper rifles, but keeps his equipment minimal to avoid suspicion and allow his own body to be the main weapon he needs. Weapons/Armor/Equipment:
Suppressed Nue x1
Netrunner Undersuit x1
External Cyberdeck x1
Combat Helm x1

Backstory: Riley is a former Intelligence Analyst for the New Unites States of America, currently working as a Private Investigator and Solo in Night City. He was seemingly let go roughly six months ago, and moved to Night City soon after. Together, he and his wife have been running the Nultide Detective Agency, a private investigation agency that the two of them formed a few months after they arrived. However, there may be more going on behind the scenes - something that he may not even be telling his wife about. In reality, Watson is one of several active NUSA Agents within Night City, gathering intelligence on behalf of his government and doing odd jobs to appear to be "staying afloat" in the meantime. His wife knows minimal details as to avoid an information breach, but still has suspicions.

Additional Notes: I'm not sure how y'all as event planners want to utilize me as a private investigator or as a NUSA Agent, but if you want to give me some sort of fucked up/amoral orders that I have to follow through occasionally throughout the RP that could add to the tension and his inevitable mental breakdown, lol. Image(s): Will be added after. Business Form:
Business Name: Nultide Detective Agency
Years in operation: 0 years, 3 months. Overall Monthly Operating Costs: 250
Starting Inventory: Unsure what I'd put here for the inventory. Employees: Riley Watson | Arlo Watson (Unsure what character name they're going for yet, still got to sit down and make their sheet) 
Regarding the cyberware, as per the lore and tabletop, there exists subdermal armor that is discreet and doesn't quite look synthetic. However, to balance it out and keep it at a 3, I would suggest that it is less effective at stopping small arms fire than a more obvious, thicker subdermal plating. And with the basic cyberoptics, it would be a stripped down/less powerful version of the "SmartEyes" that are in the cyberware list - no thermals or night vision. **MedusaCascade**: Name: John "Nobody" Seymour 
 Age: 25
Occupation: Black Market Dealer 
Psychological Profile: Sociopath
Physical Description: 5'10, wears a black Three Piece Suit with an Overcoat
Chrome/Implants: Fully Organic
Skills/Abilities: Some Weapons Handling and Hand to Hand Combat
Weapons/Armor/Equipment: Briefcase
Backstory:

John "Nobody" Seymour was born around 2052 to a Nomadic Group within a a small settlement outside of Arizona near no hospital essentially making him a "John Doe". The Nomadic Group despises any form of Cyberware due to it meaning you'd lose your humanity has is prejudice towards the NUSA and USA due to generational trauma; therefore, the teaching was engraved into him throughout his childhood. Around his Teenage years the small Nomadic Group reached the outskirts of Yuma where a local Scavenger Gang happened to stumble on the Group and raided their camp. After discovering they lacked any form of Cyberware their leader gave an ultimatum that they will take "new recruits" or kill everyone for enjoyment. The Group gave up some people, including John and then promptly killed all within the camp, excluding the new inductees, including John's Family. Although John hated the Scavs, he had no choice but to learn and adapt. Throughout this time, he worked for the Scavs for a short period of time until he was introduced to the black-market by the Scav Leader where he was also introduced to a dealer that was told he was a "John Doe" and a "Fully Organic". John ended up learning from the dealer about the ins-and-outs while also getting various Cyberware for the dealer. While patrolling Yuma, he overheard a "Clean-Up" operation from a group of Cooperate Soldiers. While making his way back to the Delaers the Cooperate Soldiers began arriving within the area enmass and began telling civilians to either begin paying for luxury apartments or be evicted by force.

After a small scuffle between a Soldier and Civilian, the soldiers began killing indiscrimatly including the dealer who was caught in the cross-fire. Throughout the Chaos, John took his briefcase of cash he has saved up and was able to accumulate and laid low. He made his way to a tailor to purchase a suit around his frame, a fedora, balaclava, shades and made his way out of Yuma to Night City. Utilizing the remaining cash, he was smuggled into the city. Not knowing anything of the city, the gangs, or having any form of income. He has set goals:

Integrate with the current Blackmarket and then control the flow of everything within' Night City. Sell arms, Bioware and Cyberware  to gain cash. He sells to everyone. He hates Gangs, Cooperation's, and the Buercracy. But if you sell them and let them kill one another off? That'll do. Innocents need arms? They can now defend themselves. If the Civilians die, hope they killed one of the Big Three. If they died without doing any, they can be still be useful as they will fuel a greater machine. Additional Notes:

**MedusaCascade**: 🧠 Current Character Summary:

Name: Leon
Age: 25
Pronouns: He/Him
Occupation: Unemployed (Former Arasaka Guard)
Cyberware:

    Titanium Bone Lacing (2 Cyberware Points)

        Provides increased durability, melee resistance, and structural reinforcement. Slight boost to unarmed melee strength. ⚙️ Physical Description:

    Tall, canine-styled exotic (likely full-body aesthetic augment or gene-modded to look anthro). Formerly athletic; current state is unkempt and run-down due to depression. Clothing likely simple, scavenged, or practical. 🧠 Psychological Profile:

    PTSD, social anxiety, and trauma from abuse. Introverted and cautious—very high emotional walls. May drink to cope, but isn't completely self-destructive. Secretly yearns for connection or companionship, but is afraid of being used again. 🧱 Backstory Changes & Clarifications:

    Arasaka Origins:
    Attended Arasaka Academy as a youth, excelling in wrestling and physical sports. Good enough student to be recruited into a corporate protection/security program. Assignment:
    Assigned to protect Haru Adachi, an Arasaka executive. Their relationship was professional but friendly. He viewed the assignment as a chance to gain favor, reputation, and long-term security. Assault & Fallout:
    Haru made repeated unwanted advances. After continued rejections, she drugged and sexually assaulted him at a corporate party. When Leon reported the incident to higher-ups, Arasaka quietly terminated him and seized all assets to protect Haru’s reputation. Current State:
    Left with no job, housing, or credits—Leon has been cast aside. Currently struggling to survive and make sense of life after betrayal. He has no strong direction yet but is open to finding purpose—whether that means healing, revenge, or reconnecting with people. 🔧 Equipment:

    AJM-50 Auto Pistol

    Titanium Machete

    Likely simple or scavenged clothing and armor.

Sirati Feth—known in the Net as “Bitch Witch”—was once a ghost in the machine for an unnamed corp (likely Arasaka or Kang Tao). As the netrunner of a black ops espionage team, fae was a phantom with a purpose—until the mission went bad. Burned and abandoned, fae resurfaced as a joytoy to survive—using sex, stories, and style to stay hidden in plain sight. Fae now supplements faer income with dangerous netrunning gigs, slowly rebuilding power while constantly looking over faer shoulder. Fae talks to faer dead crew, seeks safety in familiar rituals, and fights off the looming whisper of cyberpsychosis. Beneath the mascara and smirks is a brilliant ghost who just wants to feel safe again.
